intro: Conomorpha weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's conomorpha, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Andes Mountains of South America, particularly in regions of Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
